fields.description:
After registering an image using euca-register with _-n_ option (name option)  - which is required by AWS, euca-describe-images doesn't display image with name (which breaks AWS compatibility).

*Eucalyptus*

{code}
# euca-register -n precise-kernel precise-06182013-kernel/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-vmlinuz-virtual.manifest.xml
IMAGE	eki-7E8E35CD
# euca-describe-images eki-94C4374E
IMAGE	eki-94C4374E	precise-06182013-kernel/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-vmlinuz-virtual.manifest.xml	185153644748	available	private	x86_64	kernel				instance-store
{code}

*AWS*

{code}
# ec2-register -n precise-test precise-test-bucket/image.manifest.xml -K /tmp/cert/pk-WGRQ57KVHUFLNODZW53HEQJZWFLWDKQC.pem -C /tmp/cert/cert-WGRQ57KVHUFLNODZW53HEQJZWFLWDKQC.pem
IMAGE	ami-4353222a
# ec2-describe-images ami-4353222a
IMAGE	ami-4353222a	986451091583/precise-test	986451091583	available	private		x86_64	machine	aki-88aa75e1			instance-store	paravirtual	xen
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EPHEMERAL	sda2	ephemeral0
{code}

comments.body: I have attached the fix for this issue as TOOLS-390.patch

This looks more to me like a difference in EC2's output vs. Eucalyptus's, not ec2-describe-images's vs. euca-describe-images's.  Would you please reproduce this issue with both tools pointing at the same image and endpoint?-

[~gholms] You are correct Garrett the output from both ec2-describe-images and euca-describe-images are the same when pointed at the same image and endpoint. I am closing this as not a bug.
{code}
[mmunn:~]euca-register -n TEST_NAME tmpq67moornav/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml
IMAGE	emi-8F6837A5
[mmunn:~]ec2-describe-images emi-8F6837A5
IMAGE	emi-8F6837A5	tmpq67moornav/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml	096197277238	available	private		x86_64machine	eki-B02C3954	eri-F96C3F88	
[mmunn:~]euca-describe-images emi-8F6837A5
IMAGE	emi-8F6837A5	tmpq67moornav/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml	096197277238	available	private	x86_64	machineeki-B02C3954	eri-F96C3F88		instance-store	paravirtualized
{code}

Reopened due to retesting of EUCA-6560.  Looks like ec2-tools is concatenating the <imageOwnerId> and <name>, and euca2ools is using <ImageLocation>.  Here is the comparison that I did:

*Instance-backed*

_euca2ools_
{code}
$ euca-describe-images ami-65a2f40c --region aws:us-east-1 --debug
2013-10-05 10:26:27,749 DEBUG   DescribeImages parsed arguments: {'all': False, 'userregion': 'aws:us-east-1', 'filters': None, 'url': None, 'ImageId': ['ami-65a2f40c'], 'shell_configfile': '', 'deprecated_key_id': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'Owner': None, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None, 'ExecutableBy': None}
…..
2013-10-05 10:26:28,256 DEBUG   DescribeImages -- response content --
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<DescribeImagesResponse xmlns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2013-02-01/">
    <requestId>6e4d6c23-5c36-4a38-a9e1-0a36ef2f1c1e</requestId>
    <imagesSet>
        <item>
            <imageId>ami-65a2f40c</imageId>
            <imageLocation>ubuntu-us-east-1/images-testing/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005.manifest.xml</imageLocation>
            <imageState>available</imageState>
            <imageOwnerId>099720109477</imageOwnerId>
            <isPublic>true</isPublic>
            <architecture>x86_64</architecture>
            <imageType>machine</imageType>
            <kernelId>aki-88aa75e1</kernelId>
            <name>ubuntu/images-testing/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005</name>
            <rootDeviceType>instance-store</rootDeviceType>
            <blockDeviceMapping/>
            <virtualizationType>paravirtual</virtualizationType>
            <hypervisor>xen</hypervisor>
        </item>
    </imagesSet>
</DescribeImagesResponse>
2013-10-05 10:26:28,257 DEBUG   DescribeImages -- end of response content --
IMAGE	ami-65a2f40c	ubuntu-us-east-1/images-testing/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005.manifest.xml	099720109477	available	public	x86_64	machine	aki-88aa75e1			instance-store	paravirtual	xen
{code}

_ec2-tools_
{code}
$ ec2-describe-images ami-65a2f40c —verbose -H
Setting User-Agent to [ec2-api-tools 1.6.6.0]
Setting User-Agent to [ec2-api-tools 1.6.6.0]
------------------------------[ REQUEST ]-------------------------------
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/“
……
------------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------[ RESPONSE ]------------------------------
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
  <soap:Body>
    <DescribeImagesResponse xmlns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2012-12-01/">
      <requestId>04467388-f3c6-4028-9db3-ba3ab34d1497</requestId>
      <imagesSet>
        <item>
          <imageId>ami-65a2f40c</imageId>
          <imageLocation>ubuntu-us-east-1/images-testing/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005.manifest.xml</imageLocation>
          <imageState>available</imageState>
          <imageOwnerId>099720109477</imageOwnerId>
          <isPublic>true</isPublic>
          <architecture>x86_64</architecture>
          <imageType>machine</imageType>
          <kernelId>aki-88aa75e1</kernelId>
          <name>ubuntu/images-testing/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005</name>
          <rootDeviceType>instance-store</rootDeviceType>
          <blockDeviceMapping/>
          <virtualizationType>paravirtual</virtualizationType>
          <hypervisor>xen</hypervisor>
        </item>
      </imagesSet>
    </DescribeImagesResponse>
  </soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

————————————————————————————————————
Type 	ImageID	Name	Owner	State	Accessibility	ProductCodes	Architecture	ImageType	KernelId	RamdiskId	Platform	RootDeviceType	VirtualizationType	Hypervisor
IMAGE	ami-65a2f40c	099720109477/ubuntu/images-testing/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005	099720109477	available	public		x86_64	machine	aki-88aa75e1			instance-store	paravirtual	xen
{code}

*EBS-backed*

_euca2ools_
{code}
$ euca-describe-images ami-cbaff9a2 --region aws:us-east-1 --debug
2013-10-05 10:40:13,030 DEBUG   DescribeImages parsed arguments: {'all': False, 'userregion': 'aws:us-east-1', 'filters': None, 'url': None, 'ImageId': ['ami-cbaff9a2'], 'shell_configfile': '', 'deprecated_key_id': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'Owner': None, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None, 'ExecutableBy': None}
……
2013-10-05 10:40:13,643 DEBUG   DescribeImages -- response content --
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<DescribeImagesResponse xmlns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2013-02-01/">
    <requestId>56e40365-3f96-4046-bc1f-6efb4ee283e1</requestId>
    <imagesSet>
        <item>
            <imageId>ami-cbaff9a2</imageId>
            <imageLocation>099720109477/ubuntu/images-testing/ebs/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005</imageLocation>
            <imageState>available</imageState>
            <imageOwnerId>099720109477</imageOwnerId>
            <isPublic>true</isPublic>
            <architecture>x86_64</architecture>
            <imageType>machine</imageType>
            <kernelId>aki-88aa75e1</kernelId>
            <name>ubuntu/images-testing/ebs/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005</name>
            <rootDeviceType>ebs</rootDeviceType>
            <rootDeviceName>/dev/sda1</rootDeviceName>
            <blockDeviceMapping>
                <item>
                    <deviceName>/dev/sda1</deviceName>
                    <ebs>
                        <snapshotId>snap-dc7c0ddf</snapshotId>
                        <volumeSize>8</volumeSize>
                        <deleteOnTermination>true</deleteOnTermination>
                        <volumeType>standard</volumeType>
                    </ebs>
                </item>
                <item>
                    <deviceName>/dev/sdb</deviceName>
                    <virtualName>ephemeral0</virtualName>
                </item>
            </blockDeviceMapping>
            <virtualizationType>paravirtual</virtualizationType>
            <hypervisor>xen</hypervisor>
        </item>
    </imagesSet>
</DescribeImagesResponse>
2013-10-05 10:40:13,643 DEBUG   DescribeImages -- end of response content --
IMAGE	ami-cbaff9a2	099720109477/ubuntu/images-testing/ebs/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005	099720109477	available	public	x86_64	machine	aki-88aa75e1			ebs	paravirtual	xen
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sda1	snap-dc7c0ddf	8	true
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sdb
{code}

_ec2-tools_
{code}
$ ec2-describe-images ami-cbaff9a2 --verbose -H
Setting User-Agent to [ec2-api-tools 1.6.6.0]
Setting User-Agent to [ec2-api-tools 1.6.6.0]
------------------------------[ REQUEST ]-------------------------------
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/“
….
------------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------[ RESPONSE ]------------------------------
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
  <soap:Body>
    <DescribeImagesResponse xmlns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2012-12-01/">
      <requestId>9a1fe271-aeb7-4d1f-8790-5b7498e317ea</requestId>
      <imagesSet>
        <item>
          <imageId>ami-cbaff9a2</imageId>
          <imageLocation>099720109477/ubuntu/images-testing/ebs/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005</imageLocation>
          <imageState>available</imageState>
          <imageOwnerId>099720109477</imageOwnerId>
          <isPublic>true</isPublic>
          <architecture>x86_64</architecture>
          <imageType>machine</imageType>
          <kernelId>aki-88aa75e1</kernelId>
          <name>ubuntu/images-testing/ebs/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005</name>
          <rootDeviceType>ebs</rootDeviceType>
          <rootDeviceName>/dev/sda1</rootDeviceName>
          <blockDeviceMapping>
            <item>
              <deviceName>/dev/sda1</deviceName>
              <ebs>
                <snapshotId>snap-dc7c0ddf</snapshotId>
                <volumeSize>8</volumeSize>
                <deleteOnTermination>true</deleteOnTermination>
                <volumeType>standard</volumeType>
              </ebs>
            </item>
            <item>
              <deviceName>/dev/sdb</deviceName>
              <virtualName>ephemeral0</virtualName>
            </item>
          </blockDeviceMapping>
          <virtualizationType>paravirtual</virtualizationType>
          <hypervisor>xen</hypervisor>
        </item>
      </imagesSet>
    </DescribeImagesResponse>
  </soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

------------------------------------------------------------------------
Type		ImageID	Name	Owner	State	Accessibility	ProductCodes	Architecture	ImageType	KernelId	RamdiskId	Platform	RootDeviceType	VirtualizationType	Hypervisor
IMAGE	ami-cbaff9a2	099720109477/ubuntu/images-testing/ebs/ubuntu-raring-daily-amd64-server-20131005	099720109477	available	public		x86_64	machine	aki-88aa75e1			ebs	paravirtual	xen
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EBS	/dev/sda1		snap-dc7c0ddf	8	true	standard
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EPHEMERAL	/dev/sdb	ephemeral0
{code}

So I guess the question is should we follow how ec2-describe-images displays the “Name” value, or should we use the <name> value in the DescribeImageResponseItemType?
Tried to confirm using the latest ec2-api-tools against Eucalyptus 3.3.1, but ran into the bug mentioned in EUCA-7771.
I added a bit that falls back to {{imageLocation}} for images that don't have names because names haven't always been mandatory.  To test, try commit {{d640f7f}}.

{noformat}
[root@a-13 ~]# euca-register -n CHUCK_EBS -d "DISPLAY NAME" -s snap-92aa5ccc --root-device-name /dev/sda
IMAGE	emi-38eb7b0f
[root@a-13 ~]# euca-describe-images emi-38eb7b0f
IMAGE	emi-38eb7b0f	887465434866/CHUCK_EBS	887465434866	available	private	x86_64	machine				ebs	hvm	
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EBS	/dev/sda	snap-92aa5ccc	5	true		
[root@a-13 ~]# 
{noformat}
